description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee/orangutan
number of repeated trials until they succeed
level of planning required to succeed from 0 to 2 depending whether they had to consider the traps on the uppermost level only on the ahead or on second level or the third level underneath
number of levels that contain a trap (1-2)
number of times the participants had to change direction during the trial to succeed(0= no/ 1= yes)
trial order with the missing spots of those trials that were not included in the final dataset
trial order without the missing spots of those trials that were not included in the final dataset
identification number of the trap configuration
whether the same maze configuration was presented for the first or second time
whether the participants made the first movement correctly in the first trial attempt (0= incorrect/ 1= correct)
whether the participants succeeded in retrieving food in the first attempt(0=no/ 1= yes)
number of repetitions the participants would need to succeed in a trial by chance (chance level 25%)
difference between number of trials and test_value. A negative score means the participants succeeded over a chance level of four attempts
